definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized

sentences.english: He had formerly been in business at Bristol, but failed in debt to a number of people, compounded, and went to America.
sentences.chinese: 在那里他专心一志地做生意，在几年中就赚到许多钱。

sentences.english: I am willing to learn English single-mindedly.
sentences.chinese: 我愿意专心致志地学英语。

sentences.english: Open and attentive followthrough is necessary to resolve issues.
sentences.chinese: 公开和专心的追随对解决问题是必须的。

sentences.english: However, in my dream, Jabes had a full and attentive congregation ;
sentences.chinese: 但是，在我的梦里，杰别斯有专心听讲的满会堂会众。

sentences.english: Time to concentrate on studying is a good way of learning.
sentences.chinese: 惜时专心苦读是做学问的一个好方法。
要想流利你需要时间和专心练习。

sentences.english: He followed the speaker's words with the greatest attention.
sentences.chinese: 他专心一意地倾听演讲者的话。

sentences.english: He must have been competely wrapped up in his thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 他那时一定是在专心致志地思考问题。

sentences.english: One day, when I was listening devotedly.
sentences.chinese: 一天，当我正在专心的听着时。

sentences.english: Eric stated that being single, he could concentrate on developing his career.
sentences.chinese: 孙耀威笑言自由身的好处，可以专心发展事业。

sentences.english: If we follow after Jesus, we can be an overcomer.
sentences.chinese: 若我们专心跟随主，我们可以成为得胜者。

sentences.english: Only to concentrate more on things to do now is more perfect.
sentences.chinese: 只有更专注专心一意把现在的事情做到更完美。

sentences.english: Then I applied myself to the understanding of wisdom, and also of madness and folly, but I learned that this, too, is a chasing after the wind.
sentences.chinese: 我又专心察明智慧，狂妄和愚昧，乃知这也是捕风。

sentences.english: The single- minded daily discipline necessary in ballet was foreign to him.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞必须每大专心训练，这对他来说是格格不人的。

sentences.english: And I would stand by and watch quietly and intently, my eyes riveted on him.
sentences.chinese: 我便安静地站在旁边专心地望着，连眼珠也不转一下。

sentences.english: Xiaohua performance is the best students, he loves learning and concentrate on the lectures.
sentences.chinese: 小华是成绩最好学生，他热爱学习，专心听讲。

definition: concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
to set one's heart on sth (idiom)
wholeheartedly/(to devote oneself) heart and soul
to immerse oneself in/engrossed in sth/to lower the head (e.g. to avoid rain)/countersunk (of screws, rivets etc)
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to focus/to concentrate/to give one's full attention
at ease/to feel relieved/to set one's mind at rest/to keep one's mind on sth
conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
to do two things at once (idiom)/to multitask/to divide one's attention
